page.title: 02Policing in Tongue
page.content: Tongue has a {Police Station }and house built less than ten years ago which is manned by one officer. He has a beat stretching about twenty miles east, west and south, and he is respon sible to superior officers in Thurso. He has to deal with all police duties e.g. {road traffic,crimes, poaching, {licensing laws, sudden deaths, school {liaison & road safety, sheep {dippings,and offences against birds of {prey,stealing of eggs etc. The most {common offences are road traffic and {poaching deer and salmon. The officer in a small station has to be prepared to be called out even when he is officially off duty; and he may have to extend his beat if a neighbouring station is unmanned.
